name: Kin + Carta Create
description:
Technology is mobile. After a decade of the smartphone, mobile technology continues to connect people, data and things - anytime, and everywhere. This continues to unlock extraordinary opportunities, empowering both businesses and individuals to fulfil their outcomes faster.

The result? Better, more responsive operations, services and experiences - and a new standard for what ‘great’ looks like. The challenge, however, is a landscape of increasing technical complexity and a new tide of expectation that is reshaping every industry on earth.

TAB is a highly focused technology partner, built to enable organisations to thrive in a world where mobile is an expectation – not a device.

team.name: Daniel Joseph
team.bioHtml: Founder, Strategy Director @Kin + Carta Create • Worked at @TBWA, @tbwa\Media Arts launching the iPhone for Apple

jobs.title: Mid-Level Android Engineer
jobs.description:
**About Kin + Carta Create:**

At Kin + Carta Create we believe growth is built, not theorised. We’re makers, builders and creators by nature, and we come to work every day to build experiences your customers will love and technologies your business will thrive on. 

Our approach is simple: Accelerate idea-to-value by striking the ideal balance of human-centred design, Agile engineering and the realities of affecting change at scale. Including new product development, service design and cloud modernisation, we take a hands-on approach to transforming our clients’ business. We’re headquartered in London and have delivery offices in Chicago, New York, Edinburgh, Amsterdam and Buenos Aires.


**The Android Engineer role in a nutshell:**

As a mid-level Android Engineer, you will become a master of your craft working on products for some of the world’s biggest brands, such as Tesco, RBS, Shell and Ford. You will actively contribute to a project’s engineering activities from kickoff through to delivery. You will be supported in contributing to K+C Create’s Engineering culture and learn how to mentor less experienced teammates.


You will be guided in taking ownership of your work, making you integral to your project’s success and setting you up to lead the Android development within a project team.

**What you can expect:**

You’ll join our growing team of 15+ Android engineers who all share your passion for building great apps.
You’ll benefit from knowledge sharing sessions across the business, such as the Android team’s weekly meeting.
You’ll build market-leading products, typically within a team of 2-3 other Android engineers.
You’ll help shape your product’s roadmap by taking part in all aspects of project planning and delivery.
You’ll contribute to our continued growth by helping identify and interview great new teammates.

**The type of person we would love to meet:**

You are a passionate, self-motivated engineer who builds Android apps with Kotlin and/or Java.
You will bring valuable experience on topics such as UI, concurrency, persistence and architectural approaches (MVP, MVVM, Clean Architecture, etc.)
You are excited about the opportunity to work on a variety of projects.
You seek opportunities to share your knowledge and experience with others.
You are committed to writing high quality, testable code.
You enjoy collaborating as an Agile team.
You are comfortable reviewing other people’s work and suggesting improvements.
You are eager to contribute to K+C’s Engineering culture and take advantage of what’s on offer.

Kin + Carta Create believes in creating a culture where diversity, regardless of its form, is just a part of who we are. We empower every individual to share what matters to them, subsequently creating a culture where every person, regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status, is treated as a valued member of K+C!

jobs.title: Senior Android Engineer
jobs.description:
About TAB:

TAB's purpose is simple: to create products that make the world work better. It’s a lofty one, but when we inject our mobile specialism into some of the biggest companies in the world, we create game-changing products.

As the biggest team of mobile specialists in the world (over 500 people globally and over 150 in London), we believe that the opportunity for our team is increasingly exciting, as we see user experiences unbundle from smartphones into a multitude of emerging platforms and touchpoints such as cars, speakers and wearables.

We are now expanding our offering and opening up an office in Edinburgh, become one of the pioneers for our new move!

The Senior Android Engineer role in a nutshell:

As a Senior Engineer, you'll be at the heart of any project you work on. You’ll have a specialism in Android but use much broader technical experience to help steer your project team. You may bring a unique depth of knowledge in a specific topic, or you may have a breadth of expertise across many aspects of software development.

You’ll work with some of the world’s largest organisations, such as Tesco, RBS, Shell and Ford, to help define how they use mobile to drive their businesses. You’ll share your passion and experience with those around you, allowing and encouraging your less experienced teammates to step up.

At a senior level, your remit reaches beyond your project. Teammates in our internal Android community will naturally look to you for on-the-job coaching and broader career advice. Your success will be largely based on the success of those you influence.

At TAB, you will become a great leader in your field. You’ll be encouraged to work with others to shape TAB’s mobile proposition for new clients and grow our in-house team of mobile experts.

What you can expect:

You’ll join our growing team of 15+ Android engineers who all share your passion for building great apps.

You’ll benefit from knowledge sharing sessions across the business, such as the Android team’s weekly meeting.

You’ll build market-leading products, typically leading a team of 2-3 other Android engineers.

You’ll help shape your product’s roadmap by taking part in all aspects of project planning and delivery.

You’ll contribute to our continued growth by helping identify and interview great new teammates.

The type of person we would love to meet:

You are a passionate, self-motivated engineer who builds Android apps with Kotlin.

You will bring valuable experience on topics such as UI, concurrency, persistence and architectural approaches (MVC, MVP, etc.)

You are excited about the opportunity to work on a variety of projects.

You seek opportunities to share your knowledge and experience with others.

You are committed to writing high quality, testable code.

You enjoy collaborating as an Agile team.

You are comfortable reviewing other people’s work and suggesting improvements.

You are eager to contribute to TAB’s Engineering culture and take advantage of what’s on offer.

 

TAB believes in creating a culture where diversity, regardless of its form, is just a part of who we are. We empower every TABber to share what matters to them, subsequently creating a culture where every person, regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status, is treated as a valued member of TAB!

jobs.title: Senior Back-End Engineer
jobs.description:
About TAB:

TAB's purpose is simple: to create mobile experiences that make the world work better for billions of people. It’s a lofty one, but when we inject our mobile specialism into some of the biggest companies in the world, we create game-changing products.

As the biggest team of mobile specialists in the world (over 500 people globally and over 150 in London), we believe that the opportunity for our team is increasingly exciting, as we see user experiences unbundle from smartphones into a multitude of emerging platforms and touchpoints such as cars, speakers and wearables.

The Senior Back-End Engineer role in a nutshell:

As a Senior Engineer, you'll be at the heart of any project you work on. You’ll have a specialism in more than one back-end language but use much broader technical experience to help steer your project team. You may bring a unique depth of knowledge in a specific topic, or you may have a breadth of expertise across many aspects of software development.

You’ll work with some of the world’s largest organisations, such as Tesco, RBS, Shell and Ford, to help define how they use mobile to drive their businesses. You’ll share your passion and experience with those around you, allowing and encouraging your less experienced teammates to step up.

At a senior level, your remit reaches beyond your project. Teammates in our internal back-end community will naturally look to you for on-the-job coaching and broader career advice. Your success will be largely based on the success of those you influence.

At TAB, you will become a great leader in your field. You’ll be encouraged to work with others to shape TAB’s back-end proposition for new clients and grow our in-house team of mobile experts.

What you can expect:

- You’ll join our growing team of 15+ back-end engineers who all share your passion for building great products.

- You’ll benefit from knowledge sharing sessions across the business, such as the back-end team’s weekly meeting.

- You’ll build market-leading products, typically leading a team of 2-3 other engineers.

- You’ll help shape your product’s roadmap by taking part in all aspects of project planning and delivery.

- You’ll contribute to our continued growth by helping identify and interview great new teammates.

The type of person we would love to meet:

- You are a passionate, self-motivated engineer who has solid experience of building back-end API's and services 

- You are knowledgable with more than one technology stack (.Net, Java, Ruby on Rails, etc.)

- You will bring valuable experience on topics such as application state, common architectural patterns, networking, source control, infrastructure and testing frameworks. 

- You are excited about the opportunity to work on a variety of projects.

- You seek opportunities to share your knowledge and experience with others.

- You are committed to writing high quality, testable code.

- You enjoy collaborating as an Agile team.

- You are comfortable reviewing other people’s work and suggesting improvements.

- You are eager to contribute to TAB’s Engineering culture and take advantage of what’s on offer.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer
jobs.description:
About TAB

TAB's purpose is simple: to create products that make the world work better. When we combine our teams’ talents with some of the most significant companies in the world, we can create groundbreaking products.We believe that the opportunities are deeply exciting, as we see experiences unbundle from web and smartphone into a multitude of emerging platforms and touchpoints such as wearables, voice and mobility. Our cross-functional teams have already worked across all of these – want to join them?

About our Design team

As part of our 20 strong design team you'll be working on products and services for some of the world’s biggest brands. We are involved from planning through to execution, becoming an ever-present advocate for the user. You'll help the team to make informed design decisions, placing the needs of the user and the business at the centre of every piece work.

About you

You're primarily focused on human-centred design, backed by a broad knowledge of design patterns, iconography, typography and colour theory. You're concepting and visualising solutions in response to the problems, ideas and opportunities you help extract from users and partners. You drive your design decisions and rationalise them using research data, design principles, prototypes and the resulting user-testing insights. You're most effective collaborating alongside engineers, strategists and other team members to respond to the constraints of any project.

About the role

As a Senior Product Designer you'll be critical to every project you are on; able to draw on your breadth of knowledge in design to influence and lead many of the project's design decisions. You'll also be mentoring other designers, both in day-to-day project activities and as part of more formal career development across the Design team.

All designers at TAB are:

Confident using Sketch, Keynote, Adobe Suite and prototyping tools of your choice.
Keen to be client-facing, supporting the presentation of their latest design work.
Inquisitive and eager to continuously improve and learn, through books, articles, meet-ups etc.
Naturally collaborative, ego-free and able to give and take design critique constructively.
Familiar with agile methods and terminology, and/or general software dev environments.
Actively involved in growing the team by finding and attracting design talent.
Designing, prototyping and building products used by people every day.
As a Senior Product Designer at TAB, you:

Are master of your craft, confident of taking on challenges that you've not tried before.
Are the gatekeeper of and accountable for the quality of the products you work on.
Set the agenda and tempo for the more junior members of the Design team.
Coach other designers to rapidly progress their careers and contribution to TAB.
Provide context and coaching for product and Design team members in ways of working.
Help define the strategic agenda of the Design team.
Encourage the product teams to try new approaches and ways of doing things.
Explore innovative ways of creating ideas, bringing them to life and presenting them.
Look at the bigger picture to give client and customer context for design decisions.
Want to present your own thinking, ideas and design work at pitches.
Use past experience and client knowledge to spot and resolve problems.
Are confident in taking on challenging conversations and situations to get to the best product.
Represent TAB publicly by participating in talks, events and conferences.
Applying for the role

Please share examples of your work as PDFs or online case studies with your application. We’re interested in the activities you go through as you research, test and present your thinking and conclusions. For example; use of data, interviews, workshops, sketches, concepts, flows, experience maps, prototypes etc. ‘Finished’ visual designs are not the only focus here. All supplied examples will be handled in complete confidence.

About TAB

As a company, we know it is important to acknowledge the effort our people put in - which is why we have a great range of benefits in place, which increase as people grow and develop within TAB. It is one of the many ways we ensure we say thank you, and has lead to us ranking as 'Outstanding' in the independent Best Companies Index and as UK’s Top 25 fastest growing companies.If this sounds like the kind of place you want to work, apply now.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

jobs.title: Senior UX Designer
jobs.description:
About TAB

TAB's purpose is simple: to create products that make the world work better. When we combine our teams’ talents with some of the most significant companies in the world, we can create groundbreaking products.We believe that the opportunities are deeply exciting, as we see experiences unbundle from web and smartphone into a multitude of emerging platforms and touch points such as wearables, voice and mobility. Our cross-functional teams have already worked across all of these – want to join them?

About our Design team

As part of our 20 strong design team you'll be working on products and services for some of the world’s biggest brands. We are involved from planning through to execution, becoming an ever-present advocate for the user. You'll help the team to make informed design decisions, placing the needs of the user and the business at the centre of every piece work.

About you

You're primarily focussed on user experience design, applying your abilities in facilitation, user research, interaction design, information architecture and user testing – amongst others. You'll enjoy engaging with users and project partners to understand the product’s context, and synthesising your findings into easily-digestible formats for your team.

About the role

As a Senior UX Designer you'll be critical to every project you are on; able to draw on your breath of knowledge of user experience design principles and research methodologies to influence and lead many of the project's design decisions. You'll also be mentoring other designers, both in day-to-day project activities and as part of more formal career development across the Design team.

Confident using Sketch, Keynote, Adobe Suite and prototyping tools of your choice.
Keen to be client-facing, supporting the presentation of their latest design work.
Inquisitive and eager to continuously improve and learn, through books, articles, meet-ups etc.
Naturally collaborative, ego-free and able to give and take design critique constructively.
Familiar with agile methods and terminology, and/or general software dev environments.
Actively involved in growing the team by finding and attracting design talent.

Are master of your craft, confident of taking on challenges that you've not tried before.

Encourage the product teams to try new approaches and ways of doing things.
Explore innovative ways of creating ideas, bringing them to life and presenting them.
Look at the bigger picture to give client and customer context for design decisions.
Want to present your own thinking, ideas and design work at pitches.
Use past experience and client knowledge to spot and resolve problems.
Are confident in taking on challenging conversations and situations to get to the best product.

We’re interested in the activities you go through as you research, test and present your thinking and conclusions. For example; use of data, interviews, workshops, sketches, concepts, flows, experience maps, prototypes etc. ‘Finished’ visual designs are not the only focus here. All supplied examples will be handled in complete confidence.

As a company, we know it is important to acknowledge the effort our people put in - which is why we have a great range of benefits in place, which increase as people grow and develop within TAB. It is one of the many ways we ensure we say thank you, and has lead to us ranking as 'Outstanding' in the independent Best Companies Index and as UK’s Top 25 fastest growing companies.If this sounds like the kind of place you want to work, apply now.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. Set the agenda and tempo for the more junior members of the Design team.
Coach other designers to rapidly progress their careers and contribution to TAB.

Provide context and coaching for product and Design team members in ways of working.
Help define the strategic agenda of the Design team.
Encourage the product teams to try new approaches and ways of doing things.
Explore innovative ways of creating ideas, bringing them to life and presenting them.
Look at the bigger picture to give client and customer context for design decisions.
Want to present your own thinking, ideas and design work at pitches.
Use past experience and client knowledge to spot and resolve problems.
Are confident in taking on challenging conversations and situations to get to the best product.
Represent TAB publicly by participating in talks, events and conferences.
Applying for the role

Please share examples of your work as PDFs or online case studies with your application. We’re interested in the activities you go through as you research, test and present your thinking and conclusions. For example; use of data, interviews, workshops, sketches, concepts, flows, experience maps, prototypes etc. ‘Finished’ visual designs are not the only focus here. All supplied examples will be handled in complete confidence.

As a company, we know it is important to acknowledge the effort our people put in - which is why we have a great range of benefits in place, which increase as people grow and develop within TAB. It is one of the many ways we ensure we say thank you, and has lead to us ranking as 'Outstanding' in the independent Best Companies Index and as UK’s Top 25 fastest growing companies.If this sounds like the kind of place you want to work, apply now.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

jobs.title: Senior User Experience Designer
jobs.description:
About TAB

TAB's purpose is simple: to create products that make the world work better. When we combine our teams’ talents with some of the most significant companies in the world, we can create groundbreaking products.We believe that the opportunities are deeply exciting, as we see experiences unbundle from web and smartphone into a multitude of emerging platforms and touchpoints such as wearables, voice and mobility. Our cross-functional teams have already worked across all of these – want to join them?

About our Design team

As part of our 20 strong design team you'll be working on products and services for some of the world’s biggest brands. We are involved from planning through to execution, becoming an ever-present advocate for the user. You'll help the team to make informed design decisions, placing the needs of the user and the business at the centre of every piece work.

About you

You're primarily focused on human-centred design, backed by a broad knowledge of design patterns, iconography, typography and colour theory. You're concepting and visualising solutions in response to the problems, ideas and opportunities you help extract from users and partners. You drive your design decisions and rationalise them using research data, design principles, prototypes and the resulting user-testing insights. You're most effective collaborating alongside engineers, strategists and other team members to respond to the constraints of any project.

About the role

As a Senior Product Designer you'll be critical to every project you are on; able to draw on your breadth of knowledge in design to influence and lead many of the project's design decisions. You'll also be mentoring other designers, both in day-to-day project activities and as part of more formal career development across the Design team.

All designers at TAB are:

Confident using Sketch, Keynote, Adobe Suite and prototyping tools of your choice.
Keen to be client-facing, supporting the presentation of their latest design work.
Inquisitive and eager to continuously improve and learn, through books, articles, meet-ups etc.
Naturally collaborative, ego-free and able to give and take design critique constructively.
Familiar with agile methods and terminology, and/or general software dev environments.
Actively involved in growing the team by finding and attracting design talent.
Designing, prototyping and building products used by people every day.
As a Senior Product Designer at TAB, you:

Are master of your craft, confident of taking on challenges that you've not tried before.
Are the gatekeeper of and accountable for the quality of the products you work on.
Set the agenda and tempo for the more junior members of the Design team.
Coach other designers to rapidly progress their careers and contribution to TAB.
Provide context and coaching for product and Design team members in ways of working.
Help define the strategic agenda of the Design team.
Encourage the product teams to try new approaches and ways of doing things.
Explore innovative ways of creating ideas, bringing them to life and presenting them.
Look at the bigger picture to give client and customer context for design decisions.
Want to present your own thinking, ideas and design work at pitches.
Use past experience and client knowledge to spot and resolve problems.
Are confident in taking on challenging conversations and situations to get to the best product.
Represent TAB publicly by participating in talks, events and conferences.
Applying for the role

Please share examples of your work as PDFs or online case studies with your application. We’re interested in the activities you go through as you research, test and present your thinking and conclusions. For example; use of data, interviews, workshops, sketches, concepts, flows, experience maps, prototypes etc. ‘Finished’ visual designs are not the only focus here. All supplied examples will be handled in complete confidence.

About TAB

As a company, we know it is important to acknowledge the effort our people put in - which is why we have a great range of benefits in place, which increase as people grow and develop within TAB. It is one of the many ways we ensure we say thank you, and has lead to us ranking as 'Outstanding' in the independent Best Companies Index and as UK’s Top 25 fastest growing companies.If this sounds like the kind of place you want to work, apply now.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

jobs.title: Senior iOS Engineer
jobs.description:
About TAB:

TAB's purpose is simple: to create products that make the world work better. It’s a lofty one, but when we inject our mobile specialism into some of the biggest companies in the world, we create game-changing products.

As the biggest team of mobile specialists in the world (over 500 people globally and over 150 in London), we believe that the opportunity for our team is increasingly exciting, as we see user experiences unbundle from smartphones into a multitude of emerging platforms and touchpoints such as cars, speakers and wearables.

We are now expanding our offering and opening up an office in Edinburgh, become one of the pioneers for our new move!

The Senior iOS Engineer role in a nutshell:

As a Senior Engineer, you'll be at the heart of any project you work on. You’ll have a specialism in iOS but use much broader technical experience to help steer your project team. You may bring a unique depth of knowledge in a specific topic, or you may have a breadth of expertise across many aspects of software development.

You’ll work with some of the world’s largest organisations, such as Tesco, RBS, Shell and Ford, to help define how they use mobile to drive their businesses. You’ll share your passion and experience with those around you, allowing and encouraging your less experienced teammates to step up.

At a senior level, your remit reaches beyond your project. Teammates in our internal iOS community will naturally look to you for on-the-job coaching and broader career advice. Your success will be largely based on the success of those you influence.

At TAB, you will become a great leader in your field. You’ll be encouraged to work with others to shape TAB’s mobile proposition for new clients and grow our in-house team of mobile experts.

What you can expect:

You’ll join our growing team of 15+ iOS engineers who all share your passion for building great apps.

You’ll benefit from knowledge sharing sessions across the business, such as the iOS team’s weekly super.init() meeting.

You’ll build market-leading products, typically leading a team of 2-3 other iOS engineers.

You’ll help shape your product’s roadmap by taking part in all aspects of project planning and delivery.

You’ll contribute to our continued growth by helping identify and interview great new teammates.

The type of person we would love to meet:

You are a passionate, self-motivated engineer who builds iOS apps with Swift.

You will bring valuable experience on topics such as UI, concurrency, persistence and architectural approaches (MVC, MVP, etc.)

You are excited about the opportunity to work on a variety of projects.

You seek opportunities to share your knowledge and experience with others.

You are committed to writing high quality, testable code.

You enjoy collaborating as an Agile team.

You are comfortable reviewing other people’s work and suggesting improvements.

You are eager to contribute to TAB’s Engineering culture and take advantage of what’s on offer.

 

TAB believes in creating a culture where diversity, regardless of its form, is just a part of who we are. We empower every TABber to share what matters to them, subsequently creating a culture where every person, regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status, is treated as a valued member of TAB!

jobs.title: iOS Engineer
jobs.description:
About TAB:

TAB's purpose is simple: to create mobile experiences that make the world work better for billions of people. It’s a lofty one, but when we inject our mobile specialism into some of the biggest companies in the world, we create game-changing products.

As the biggest team of mobile specialists in the world (over 500 people globally and over 150 in London), we believe that the opportunity for our team is increasingly exciting, as we see user experiences unbundle from smartphones into a multitude of emerging platforms and touchpoints such as cars, speakers and wearables.

The iOS Engineer role in a nutshell:

As a mid-level iOS Engineer, you will become a master of your craft working on products for some of the world’s biggest brands, such as Tesco, RBS, Shell and Ford. You will actively contribute to a project’s engineering activities from kickoff through to delivery. You will be supported in contributing to TAB’s Engineering culture and learn how to mentor less experienced teammates.

You will be guided in taking ownership of your work, making you integral to your project’s success and setting you up to lead the iOS development within a project team.

What you can expect:

- You’ll join our growing team of 15+ iOS engineers who all share your passion for building great apps.

- You’ll benefit from knowledge sharing sessions across the business, such as the iOS team’s weekly super.init() meeting.

- You’ll build market-leading products, typically within a team of 2-3 other iOS engineers.

- You’ll help shape your product’s roadmap by taking part in all aspects of project planning and delivery.

- You’ll contribute to our continued growth by helping identify and interview great new teammates.

The type of person we would love to meet:

- You are a passionate, self-motivated engineer who builds iOS apps with Swift.

- You will bring valuable experience on topics such as UI, concurrency, persistence and architectural approaches (MVC, MVP, etc.)

- You are excited about the opportunity to work on a variety of projects.

- You seek opportunities to share your knowledge and experience with others.

- You are committed to writing high quality, testable code.

- You enjoy collaborating as an Agile team.

- You are comfortable reviewing other people’s work and suggesting improvements.

- You are eager to contribute to TAB’s Engineering culture and take advantage of what’s on offer.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

  

View our full job description here: http://bit.ly/TAB-iOS-Mid
